metadata.title: CVE-2021-38160 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** In drivers/char/virtio_console.c in the Linux kernel before5.13.4, data corruption or loss can be triggered by an untrusted devicethat supplies a buf->len value exceeding the buffer size. NOTE: the vendorindicates that the cited data corruption is not a vulnerability in anyexisting use case; the length validation was added solely for robustness inthe face of anomalous host OS behavior.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38160` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required
